metadata.title: CVE-2020-14404 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in LibVNCServer before 0.9.13. libvncserver/rre.callows out-of-bounds access via encodings.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14404` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.5
libvncserver-config - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.5
libvncserver1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

vino - 3.8.1-0ubuntu9.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.5').
vino package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.1-0ubuntu9.3').
x11vnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
